intro: Tribulus solandri var. sessilis, commonly known as the sessile burr, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a member of the Zygophyllaceae family and is characterized by its spiny, fruiting structures that aid in seed dispersal. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats and has small, alternate leaves with a rough texture. Its flowers are usually yellow or greenish-yellow, and it produces distinctive, globular fruits that contain several seeds. The plant is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
